GOD.content: properly phenomenological virtue of literature: puts thesis or arrest in quotations (parentheses) > literature’s relation to non-literary, religious remainder (Abrahamic moment), betrays in double sense of word: unfaithful to its history at moment it uncovers that history’s secret, reveals its “truth” (i.e. its [literature’s] own filiation) > literature must ask forgiveness for this double betrayal
GOD.linkedContent: properly phenomenological virtue of literature: puts thesis or arrest in quotations (parentheses) > literature’s relation to non-literary, religious remainder (Abrahamic moment), betrays in double sense of word: unfaithful to its history at moment it uncovers that history’s secret, reveals its “truth” (i.e. its [literature’s] own filiation) > literature must ask forgiveness for this double betrayal

GT.content: the remainder is what you can give (the all is what is taken, the whole of her desire)
GT.linkedContent: the remainder is what you can give (the all is what is taken, the whole of her desire)

GT.content: whole economy of narrative [“Counterfeit Money”] proceeds from a remainder, change returned, return of an unproductive expenditure [capitalizes?]
GT.linkedContent: whole economy of narrative [“Counterfeit Money”] proceeds from a remainder, change returned, return of an unproductive expenditure [capitalizes?]

GT.content: “Purloined Letter” & “Counterfeit Money” proceed from surplus-value of remnant or a superfluity of revenue (income or inheritance)
GT.linkedContent: “Purloined Letter” & “Counterfeit Money” proceed from surplus-value of remnant or a superfluity of revenue (income or inheritance)

R.content: at least since Glas, the remaining [restance] withdraws from ontological dependence, no present of essence or existence
R.linkedContent: at least since Glas, the remaining [restance] withdraws from ontological dependence, no present of essence or existence

MONL.content: [gift] remains only on this condition: still remaining to be given
MONL.linkedContent: [gift] remains only on this condition: still remaining to be given

LOBL.content: starting point: “no meaning can be determined out of context, but no context permits saturation” > structure of remnant/iteration (I have said this many other ways)
LOBL.linkedContent: starting point: “no meaning can be determined out of context, but no context permits saturation” > structure of remnant/iteration (I have said this many other ways)

LOBL.content: arrêt arrests itself, stands, stays unstable, remains on arête of itself, it a-rests (for) itself, no consciousness, perception, no watchfulness can gather this remnance, no “I”, hence ghosts, fantasies, epochal pause
LOBL.linkedContent: arrêt arrests itself, stands, stays unstable, remains on arête of itself, it a-rests (for) itself, no consciousness, perception, no watchfulness can gather this remnance, no “I”, hence ghosts, fantasies, epochal pause

LOBL.content: translation leaves behind an untranslated remnant, illegitimately, because it arrests the movement of the everyday possibility of literature and parasitism [see SPOM p. 135 translation causes ghost to drop into oblivion] [re: double syntax of arrêt de mort]
LOBL.linkedContent: translation leaves behind an untranslated remnant, illegitimately, because it arrests the movement of the everyday possibility of literature and parasitism [see SPOM p. 135 translation causes ghost to drop into oblivion] [re: double syntax of arrêt de mort]

LOBL.content: dream of a translation w/out remnants: a metalanguage, a guarantee
LOBL.linkedContent: dream of a translation w/out remnants: a metalanguage, a guarantee

SEC.content: logic of paleonymy, provisional conservation of old name, while liberating, “grafting,” excluded, subordinated predicates (resistances, remainders of dominant force)
SEC.linkedContent: logic of paleonymy, provisional conservation of old name, while liberating, “grafting,” excluded, subordinated predicates (resistances, remainders of dominant force)

POO.content: if simulacrum bears witness to a possibility that exceeds it, exceeding remains, il (est) le reste, il le rest
POO.linkedContent: if simulacrum bears witness to a possibility that exceeds it, exceeding remains, il (est) le reste, il le rest

AF.content: one cannot objectivize the archive [call on its names, employ it, make it gain in auctoritas] w/out remainder, archive produces more archive, never closed, opens to the future
AF.linkedContent: one cannot objectivize the archive [call on its names, employ it, make it gain in auctoritas] w/out remainder, archive produces more archive, never closed, opens to the future

A.content: experience of aporia: passion, endurance, resistance, remainder
A.linkedContent: experience of aporia: passion, endurance, resistance, remainder

PAS.content: [list of Blanchot’s many sans constructions] X sans X forms the trace or the pas of the toute autre that acts on itself there (s’y agit) > degree o (eau); il reste un reste sans reste de ce passage (il y a —pas—rien, un texte, un récit, déjà)
PAS.linkedContent: [list of Blanchot’s many sans constructions] X sans X forms the trace or the pas of the toute autre that acts on itself there (s’y agit) > degree o (eau); il reste un reste sans reste de ce passage (il y a —pas—rien, un texte, un récit, déjà)

PAS.content: if being is another name for forgetting, places forgetting in a crypt, forgets forgetting, in naming forgetting one makes it disappear under its name [(un)names], vs. pas sous le nom d’oubli > le reste sans reste de cet effacement qui ne s’efface plus, voilà ce qu’il y a peut-être, par chance, mais qui n’est pas ou qui est pas
PAS.linkedContent: if being is another name for forgetting, places forgetting in a crypt, forgets forgetting, in naming forgetting one makes it disappear under its name [(un)names], vs. pas sous le nom d’oubli > le reste sans reste de cet effacement qui ne s’efface plus, voilà ce qu’il y a peut-être, par chance, mais qui n’est pas ou qui est pas

SH.content: poem speaks beyond knowledge, this is its remnance, partakes in unimpartable
SH.linkedContent: poem speaks beyond knowledge, this is its remnance, partakes in unimpartable

F.content: via Abraham’s “radical semantic change that psychoanalysis introduced into language,” beneath paleonymy of inherited concepts, working w/ remnants [i.e. beneath “pleasure” we find pain]: to bring intending non-presence into phenomenology
F.linkedContent: via Abraham’s “radical semantic change that psychoanalysis introduced into language,” beneath paleonymy of inherited concepts, working w/ remnants [i.e. beneath “pleasure” we find pain]: to bring intending non-presence into phenomenology

POS.content: writing structurally carries w/in itself (counts-discounts) its own erasure, while marking what remains of this erasure
POS.linkedContent: writing structurally carries w/in itself (counts-discounts) its own erasure, while marking what remains of this erasure

P.content: Heidegger on how blosse Ding is only a remainder (not properly determined in itself), a concept formed alongside, w/in, Christian creationism, matter/form, & concept of Überfall
P.linkedContent: Heidegger on how blosse Ding is only a remainder (not properly determined in itself), a concept formed alongside, w/in, Christian creationism, matter/form, & concept of Überfall

ROP.content: the poleros (politics, polemos, eros, seduction) of analysis, ends in an abyss, where resistance to psychoanalytic Lösung, in the name of truth, can only be a disavowal > to analyze, to say to other: prefer, take, love my solution, you will be in truth if you do not resist my solution
ROP.linkedContent: the poleros (politics, polemos, eros, seduction) of analysis, ends in an abyss, where resistance to psychoanalytic Lösung, in the name of truth, can only be a disavowal > to analyze, to say to other: prefer, take, love my solution, you will be in truth if you do not resist my solution

ROP.content: Derrida proposes an other resistance, that of the remainder, thus a restanalysis
ROP.linkedContent: Derrida proposes an other resistance, that of the remainder, thus a restanalysis

ROP.content: entangled necessities: 1) resistance [to analysis] as double bind, other or outside at heart of internal auto-affective tension > it provokes analysis and dialectic to infinity, in order to resist both absolutely 2) resistance as la restance du reste, resists because la reste n’est ou n’este pas
ROP.linkedContent: entangled necessities: 1) resistance [to analysis] as double bind, other or outside at heart of internal auto-affective tension > it provokes analysis and dialectic to infinity, in order to resist both absolutely 2) resistance as la restance du reste, resists because la reste n’est ou n’este pas

ROP.content: deconstruction announces status w/out status of nonfinite # of names/quasi-concepts: the thinking of writing called for this, but it’s better thematized and formalized in theory of double bind, stricture of double band, and especially non-ontological remaining
ROP.linkedContent: deconstruction announces status w/out status of nonfinite # of names/quasi-concepts: the thinking of writing called for this, but it’s better thematized and formalized in theory of double bind, stricture of double band, and especially non-ontological remaining

ROP.content: la restance disséminale, hyperbolythique, destined (vouée) to chance, to ash, à un oubli radical, trace w/out trace: secret w/out depth, lieu, nom, destination, lysis w/out measure/return/anagogy
ROP.linkedContent: la restance disséminale, hyperbolythique, destined (vouée) to chance, to ash, à un oubli radical, trace w/out trace: secret w/out depth, lieu, nom, destination, lysis w/out measure/return/anagogy

SP.content: remainder: no proper itinerary, no center, could mean nothing, no end to parodying play w/ meaning, grafted beyond any contextual body or finite code
SP.linkedContent: remainder: no proper itinerary, no center, could mean nothing, no end to parodying play w/ meaning, grafted beyond any contextual body or finite code

O.content: residue of writing remains anterior/exterior to content it announces
O.linkedContent: residue of writing remains anterior/exterior to content it announces

O.content: preface’s (double inscription’s) semantic envelopment in Book (representative of ontotheology, absolute knowledge) > restance (left-overness) of its textual exteriority should not be confused w/ Book’s physical thickness
O.linkedContent: preface’s (double inscription’s) semantic envelopment in Book (representative of ontotheology, absolute knowledge) > restance (left-overness) of its textual exteriority should not be confused w/ Book’s physical thickness

O.content: re: writing, Hegel does not think exteriority, repetitive autonomy of remainder > writing becomes pro-gramme, pre-scription, pre-text, the simple empirical husk (déchet) of concept
O.linkedContent: re: writing, Hegel does not think exteriority, repetitive autonomy of remainder > writing becomes pro-gramme, pre-scription, pre-text, the simple empirical husk (déchet) of concept

O.content: for Derrida, this husk is coextensive w/ whole life of discourse
O.linkedContent: for Derrida, this husk is coextensive w/ whole life of discourse

DPi.content: Hugo’s abolitionism: disappearance of social order of past (priest, executioner, king), but order remains, what counts is what remains, the reste, of the turning, of the Christian Aufhebung ——Hugo: “cross will be substituted for the gallows”
DPi.linkedContent: Hugo’s abolitionism: disappearance of social order of past (priest, executioner, king), but order remains, what counts is what remains, the reste, of the turning, of the Christian Aufhebung ——Hugo: “cross will be substituted for the gallows”

REST.content: the pair (of shoes) might not come back to anyone: disappoint desire to reattribute surplus value > might have been made to “remain” there, defying the tribute
REST.linkedContent: the pair (of shoes) might not come back to anyone: disappoint desire to reattribute surplus value > might have been made to “remain” there, defying the tribute

REST.content: desire for attribution is a desire for appropriation (in matters of art, & everywhere else)
REST.linkedContent: desire for attribution is a desire for appropriation (in matters of art, & everywhere else)

REST.content: Heidegger: naked thing (blosse Ding) is a sort of product (Zeug), one divested of its being-product, its usefulness (Dienlichkeit)
REST.linkedContent: Heidegger: naked thing (blosse Ding) is a sort of product (Zeug), one divested of its being-product, its usefulness (Dienlichkeit)

REST.content: being-thing, a remainder (Rest) not determined in itself
REST.linkedContent: being-thing, a remainder (Rest) not determined in itself

REST.content: Heidegger’s subtraction of the product-work to get to the naked thing will not restitute the “remainder” to us as a “naked” thing: must “think” remainder otherwise
REST.linkedContent: Heidegger’s subtraction of the product-work to get to the naked thing will not restitute the “remainder” to us as a “naked” thing: must “think” remainder otherwise

REST.content: a certain type of strict commentary on Heidegger, a restitution of him, becomes obscene, his language is no longer recognizable > thinking otherwise means thinking otherwise than he who attempts to think the remainder “properly”—that is, otherwise than properly
REST.linkedContent: a certain type of strict commentary on Heidegger, a restitution of him, becomes obscene, his language is no longer recognizable > thinking otherwise means thinking otherwise than he who attempts to think the remainder “properly”—that is, otherwise than properly

REST.content: remainder, instance of letting fall, this lowness: is it the foot?
REST.linkedContent: remainder, instance of letting fall, this lowness: is it the foot?

REST.content: Van Gogh’s scene: “make oneself a present of the remainder (Glas)”
REST.linkedContent: Van Gogh’s scene: “make oneself a present of the remainder (Glas)”

REST.content: “projection” belongs to system of adequate subject-object relations or of truth (unveiling, adequation) > no longer stands up in unconscious or remainder-structure
REST.linkedContent: “projection” belongs to system of adequate subject-object relations or of truth (unveiling, adequation) > no longer stands up in unconscious or remainder-structure

REST.content: “useless hermeticism [Artaud]” of crypted remainder, secret already legible, separation already in the word, the letter, the pair > opening of secret
REST.linkedContent: “useless hermeticism [Artaud]” of crypted remainder, secret already legible, separation already in the word, the letter, the pair > opening of secret

PF.content: concept w/out concept of resistance, brought in line (after twists/turns) w/ desistance, especially restance (restance in Glas: being “nothing,” w/out substance, upsets ontological question “What is it?”—older than distinction btwn “who” and “what”)
PF.linkedContent: concept w/out concept of resistance, brought in line (after twists/turns) w/ desistance, especially restance (restance in Glas: being “nothing,” w/out substance, upsets ontological question “What is it?”—older than distinction btwn “who” and “what”)

PF.content: res(is)ts > what remains to be thought resists thought, in advance, remains in advance
PF.linkedContent: res(is)ts > what remains to be thought resists thought, in advance, remains in advance

PF.content: only know what thought means by way of what resists/remains to be thought, thought remains to be thought
PF.linkedContent: only know what thought means by way of what resists/remains to be thought, thought remains to be thought

+R.content: Benjamin: secularization causes indeterminacy of “once only (Einmaligkeit),” once-only of phenomena replaced by once-only of artistic operation (never w/out remainder)
+R.linkedContent: Benjamin: secularization causes indeterminacy of “once only (Einmaligkeit),” once-only of phenomena replaced by once-only of artistic operation (never w/out remainder)

C.content: remainder itself, in its structure as remainder, will have been w/out (w/out example, w/out precedent)
C.linkedContent: remainder itself, in its structure as remainder, will have been w/out (w/out example, w/out precedent)

C.content: revenant—127 times, what of the remains is being put into figures (chiffré) in this way?
C.linkedContent: revenant—127 times, what of the remains is being put into figures (chiffré) in this way?

C.content: analogy belongs to order of contingent > appeals neither to model nor example (i.e. both Sade & Titus-Carmel ration the remainder, stage a work & jouissance re: remainder [excrement]) [Derrida is “randomly” comparing Titus-Carmel’s 127 coffins to Sade’s 120 days]
C.linkedContent: analogy belongs to order of contingent > appeals neither to model nor example (i.e. both Sade & Titus-Carmel ration the remainder, stage a work & jouissance re: remainder [excrement]) [Derrida is “randomly” comparing Titus-Carmel’s 127 coffins to Sade’s 120 days]

C.content: one cannot get to it in one go (d’un coup): multiplication shows that that which touches on the series is outside the series in the series > the remainder remains cut off, a mors, a turd, really beautiful
C.linkedContent: one cannot get to it in one go (d’un coup): multiplication shows that that which touches on the series is outside the series in the series > the remainder remains cut off, a mors, a turd, really beautiful

C.content: a turd one would like to make one’s own (s’approprier)—until the end > until is interminable
C.linkedContent: a turd one would like to make one’s own (s’approprier)—until the end > until is interminable

C.content: the odd is indivisible, remainder remains entire

bananas [re: Titus-Carmel’s The Great Cultu…] would be copies of copies w/out example, phantasmata, if force of ductus did not carry the remainder beyond any phantasy, beyond the signature, proper name, nameable [cf. pp. 220-21 also beyond hierarchy]
C.linkedContent: bananas [re: Titus-Carmel’s The Great Cultu…] would be copies of copies w/out example, phantasmata, if force of ductus did not carry the remainder beyond any phantasy, beyond the signature, proper name, nameable [cf. pp. 220-21 also beyond hierarchy]

C.content: remainder is neither produced nor reproduced/represented [in Titus-Carmel’s coffins], classical thought re: remainder reduced to ashes > yet we retain at least more than one monumental proof (at least 127) of this historical operation
C.linkedContent: remainder is neither produced nor reproduced/represented [in Titus-Carmel’s coffins], classical thought re: remainder reduced to ashes > yet we retain at least more than one monumental proof (at least 127) of this historical operation

C.content: send oneself [TN. s’envoyer, “get landed w/,” “make it w/”] the remainder, that’s (the) desire, and its impossibility
C.linkedContent: send oneself [TN. s’envoyer, “get landed w/,” “make it w/”] the remainder, that’s (the) desire, and its impossibility

LI.content: SEC doesn’t concern permanence but non-present remains
restance as remainder: if it’s not a perfect translation, no single word out of context can by itself translate a word perfectly
LI.linkedContent: restance as remainder: if it’s not a perfect translation, no single word out of context can by itself translate a word perfectly

LI.content: associating non-present w/ restance adds spectacular blinking-effect to warning light: rhythm of blinking essential to mark
LI.linkedContent: associating non-present w/ restance adds spectacular blinking-effect to warning light: rhythm of blinking essential to mark

LI.content: remainder, not that of signifier any more than that of signified, of the “token,” of “type,” of form or content
LI.linkedContent: remainder, not that of signifier any more than that of signified, of the “token,” of “type,” of form or content

LI.content: remainder (nothing in common w/ scripta manent) bound up w/ minimal possibility of re-mark & w/ structure of iterability
LI.linkedContent: remainder (nothing in common w/ scripta manent) bound up w/ minimal possibility of re-mark & w/ structure of iterability

LI.content: structure of iteration implies both identity (minimum of idealization) and difference (minimum of remainder)
LI.linkedContent: structure of iteration implies both identity (minimum of idealization) and difference (minimum of remainder)

LI.content: iterability of an element divides its own identity a priori > differential btwn & w/in elements
LI.linkedContent: iterability of an element divides its own identity a priori > differential btwn & w/in elements

LI.content: “concept” of remainder not a sure thing (de tout repos), concept in quotes because remainder deconstructs the logic upon which the concept of the “concept” depends
LI.linkedContent: “concept” of remainder not a sure thing (de tout repos), concept in quotes because remainder deconstructs the logic upon which the concept of the “concept” depends

LI.content: structure of remainder, implying alteration, renders all absolute permanence impossible
LI.linkedContent: structure of remainder, implying alteration, renders all absolute permanence impossible

LI.content: [re: SEC] Derrida replaces “of God” w/ “of writing,” where iterability of the proof (of God) produces writing > name of God drawn into graphematic drift (dérive): does name of God refer to God or name of God? “perhaps” of “that it perhaps does not exist” marks fact that “possibility” of graphematics places writing (remainder) outside ontology > [God should exist but in relation to name/reference that “perhaps” does not]
LI.linkedContent: [re: SEC] Derrida replaces “of God” w/ “of writing,” where iterability of the proof (of God) produces writing > name of God drawn into graphematic drift (dérive): does name of God refer to God or name of God? “perhaps” of “that it perhaps does not exist” marks fact that “possibility” of graphematics places writing (remainder) outside ontology > [God should exist but in relation to name/reference that “perhaps” does not]

LI.content: the rest of the trace, its remains (restance), neither present nor absent
LI.linkedContent: the rest of the trace, its remains (restance), neither present nor absent

ATM.content: no utterance ever cut from all context, context never annulled w/out remainder: one negotiates w/ les effets de bord, incl. nonnegotiable, that which overflows (déborde) all context
ATM.linkedContent: no utterance ever cut from all context, context never annulled w/out remainder: one negotiates w/ les effets de bord, incl. nonnegotiable, that which overflows (déborde) all context

E.content: if mourning always consists in biting off the bit (le mors), a remainder, a corpse, the disgusting can only be vomited
E.linkedContent: if mourning always consists in biting off the bit (le mors), a remainder, a corpse, the disgusting can only be vomited

WOG.content: the remainder (of all ontology) and the contamination btwn tout autre and its regular reappropriation (economic redialectization) haunts all Derrida’s essays on the Greeks
WOG.linkedContent: the remainder (of all ontology) and the contamination btwn tout autre and its regular reappropriation (economic redialectization) haunts all Derrida’s essays on the Greeks

WOG.content: the non-discursive remainder, the resistance of the pharmakon, exceeds (is not only) the simulacrum or phantasm—whose repetition disorganizes dialectic
WOG.linkedContent: the non-discursive remainder, the resistance of the pharmakon, exceeds (is not only) the simulacrum or phantasm—whose repetition disorganizes dialectic

CIN.content: cinders: ce qui garde pour ne plus même garder, dooming (vouant) remnant (le reste) to dissolution
CIN.linkedContent: cinders: ce qui garde pour ne plus même garder, dooming (vouant) remnant (le reste) to dissolution

CIN.content: “l’incinéré n’est plus rien fors la cendre [innermost cinder furnace], un reste qui se doit de ne plus rester, ce lieu de rien qui soit, un lieu pur se chiffrât-il [marked out]” > there are cinders, what takes place in letting a place occur
CIN.linkedContent: “l’incinéré n’est plus rien fors la cendre [innermost cinder furnace], un reste qui se doit de ne plus rester, ce lieu de rien qui soit, un lieu pur se chiffrât-il [marked out]” > there are cinders, what takes place in letting a place occur

CIN.content: dissemination expresses in “il y a là cendre” what is destined by the fire to dispersion w/out return, pyrificiation of what doesn’t remain, and returns to no one
CIN.linkedContent: dissemination expresses in “il y a là cendre” what is destined by the fire to dispersion w/out return, pyrificiation of what doesn’t remain, and returns to no one

CIN.content: cinder remains, cinder there is, nonbeing, nonpresence
CIN.linkedContent: cinder remains, cinder there is, nonbeing, nonpresence

CIN.content: cinder & smoke (fumée): smoke gets lost w/out perceptible remainder, spirited away, sublimates; cinder falls (tombe), lets go, heavy, more material because it fritters away its word: it is very divisible ——cinder, nothing that can be in the world, remains beyond everything that is (konis epekeina tēs ousias), giving itself (es gibt ashes)—it’s nothing
CIN.linkedContent: cinder & smoke (fumée): smoke gets lost w/out perceptible remainder, spirited away, sublimates; cinder falls (tombe), lets go, heavy, more material because it fritters away its word: it is very divisible ——cinder, nothing that can be in the world, remains beyond everything that is (konis epekeina tēs ousias), giving itself (es gibt ashes)—it’s nothing

SPEC.content: Beyond… is a-thetic, no (final) judgment (instance), indefinite suspension re: life death > death drive appears/disappears while telling stories, making scenes: myths, fables (literary)
SPEC.linkedContent: Beyond… is a-thetic, no (final) judgment (instance), indefinite suspension re: life death > death drive appears/disappears while telling stories, making scenes: myths, fables (literary)

SPEC.content: repetition, reproductivity, works w/out saying anything, like death drive, not even “form,” w/out thesis, de-monstration makes its proof (preuve) sans montrer > de-monstration folds into everything it makes explicit, pas de démonstration remains (reste) in this restance
SPEC.linkedContent: repetition, reproductivity, works w/out saying anything, like death drive, not even “form,” w/out thesis, de-monstration makes its proof (preuve) sans montrer > de-monstration folds into everything it makes explicit, pas de démonstration remains (reste) in this restance

SPEC.content: the unanalyzed remainder of an unconscious remains [re: Freud’s autobiographical, writing], Derrida: “je parie” that it will be transmitted blindly by all who “return to Freud”: remainder that works the scene is illegible—i.e. restance, yet the only urgency of what reste à faire
SPEC.linkedContent: the unanalyzed remainder of an unconscious remains [re: Freud’s autobiographical, writing], Derrida: “je parie” that it will be transmitted blindly by all who “return to Freud”: remainder that works the scene is illegible—i.e. restance, yet the only urgency of what reste à faire

FV.content: letter found “in” the text which escapes, from 4th side, eyes of Dupin/analyst [letter not found in sealed interior of Poe’s tale, not assignable lack, definable hole]
FV.linkedContent: letter found “in” the text which escapes, from 4th side, eyes of Dupin/analyst [letter not found in sealed interior of Poe’s tale, not assignable lack, definable hole]

FV.content: the text The Purloined Letter: the open, the very open, letter that is fiction
FV.linkedContent: the text The Purloined Letter: the open, the very open, letter that is fiction

FV.content: [profiting from remnant] by means of a remnant of paternal inheritance, one the debtors left out of account, Dupin draws revenue, surplus-value of a capital that works by itself, calculating (rigorous economy) > Dupin can pay for a sole luxury [Dupin’s desire to read]: cuts across restricted economy like gift w/out return
FV.linkedContent: [profiting from remnant] by means of a remnant of paternal inheritance, one the debtors left out of account, Dupin draws revenue, surplus-value of a capital that works by itself, calculating (rigorous economy) > Dupin can pay for a sole luxury [Dupin’s desire to read]: cuts across restricted economy like gift w/out return

FV.content: signer dispossessed [re: The Purloined…], signature in quotations: ce reste est encore de la littérature
FV.linkedContent: signer dispossessed [re: The Purloined…], signature in quotations: ce reste est encore de la littérature
